intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. oreites, commonly known as the oreite hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lanceolate leaves and produces yellow flowering heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and is adapted to rocky and dry habitats. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has a compact, cushion-like growth form. The subspecies is distinguished by its finely divided, bifid leaves and its ability to thrive in alpine environments.
